clues.text: Writers resting at the Sleepy Hollow Cemetery in Concord, Mass. include Emerson & this Walden Pond ponderer
Simone de Beauvoir & this boyfriend share a grave at the Montparnasse cemetery in Paris
The most-visited grave site at St. Mary's cemetery in Rockville Maryland is that of this author & his wife Zelda
After his death in 1968, some of his ashes were scattered along the California coast, the rest were buried in Salinas
Her epitaph "Excuse My Dust" is famous; fewer know that it's on a plaque at NAACP HQ, where her ashes are buried
One of the two African Americans to win the prize, one in 1950, the other in 1964
clues.response: Martin Luther King, Jr. (& Ralph Bunche)

clues.text: It's the number of U.S. presidents who've won the award
This international organization won in 1917, 1944 & 1963
Though he never won, he was nominated in 1937, 1938, 1939, 1947 & again in 1948 a few days before his assassination
In 1991 Aung San Suu Kyi won the Peace Prize while living under house arrest in this nation
On April 1, 1992 NPR reported that this disgraced U.S. president was running again for the job, prompting a flood of calls
In the 1790s a sensation gripped England when William Ireland revealed a "new" play by this man titled "Vortigern"
While at this Ithaca university, Hugh Troy used a rhinoceros foot to leave tracks in the snow around the school
In 1957 the British TV show "Panorama" reported on a bumper crop of this pasta grown in trees
Unearthed in 1869, this 10-foot "giant" wasn't a prehistoric man but a hoax buried & "discovered" by George Hull
Once a term for a carnival performer who bit the heads off chickens, it now usually refers to a tech nerd
As a verb, it means to order your child to his room & take away his privileges
Follow these double-talk dancers to your local discotheque
Also known as chickpeas, these beans are the main ingredient in hummus
The place on deck where passengers enter the vessel, it's also a cry to "get out of my path!"
The U.S. Navy bought the first modern one of these, which used gasoline on the surface & electricity below
Unlike 2000, 1900 wasn't one of these, so Thursday, March 1 followed Wednesday, Feb. 28
One of these natural disasters killed 6,000 people on the Texas coast
Victor Emmanuel began a 46-year rule over this country, whose people thought his name was Vittorio Emanuele
Probably slapping & cursing, Walter Reed identified this insect as the cause of yellow fever
A Spanish-speaking host may say, "Mi casa es su casa", "My" this "is your" this
It's the English meaning of the title of Wayne Newton's hit song "Danke Schoen"
From Yiddish, it can mean liquid chicken fat or a sappy, sentimental story

If you meet a fine Finn in a bar, ask for this by saying, "Mika on puhelin numeronne"
This Dylan McDermott-Lara Flynn Boyle legal show "Made Perfect" as Best Drama in 1998 & '99
David Hyde Pierce has been nominated for an Emmy 7 times for playing this "Frasier" role, winning 3 times
In 1993 Dan Castellaneta won an Emmy for voice-over for the "Mr. Plow" episode of this series
The Ken Burns series about this war won a 1991 Emmy for outstanding informational series
In 1989 Diane English won an Emmy for comedy writing for "Respect", the pilot episode of this series
Smarter than the average bear, he stole picnic baskets from Jellystone Park
Yoplait is a brand of this food
Half Dome & El Capitan are features of this California national park
Looking at a skull, Hamlet says, "Alas, poor" this fellow of infinite jest
Neil Simon wrote the play "Lost in" this city in New York
Blind since birth, he's given us such great hits as "Part-Time Lover" & "You Are The Sunshine Of My Life"
With help from "miracle worker" Anne Sullivan, she learned to speak, & to read Braille, & even graduated college
For her film role in "Children of a Lesser God", she became the first deaf actress to win an Oscar

In 1999 he returned to the screen as an elderly ex-boxer in "Diamonds", his first film role since his stroke

Coincidentally, Jerome Robbins' ballet "Fanfare" debuted on the day she was crowned in 1953
In the 1960s Maya Plisetskaya succeeded Galina Ulanova as prima ballerina of this company
Part of John Cranko's ballet based on this Shakespeare play is set in Petruchio's home
In Frederick Ashton's ballet, 4 fairies help this fairy tale heroine get dressed for the ball
At the 1992 Olympics, the U.S. Men's Basketball team was known by this rhyming name
Since the 1950s players from this continent have been the dominant force in table tennis
This piece of fencing equipment is made of strong wire mesh & may be padded
In swimming the butterfly stroke originated as a modification of this similar stroke
The origins of tennis go back to jeu de paume, a game in which the ball was struck with this body part
This duo won 1989's Best New Artist Grammy, but later it was rescinded

In 1982 he & Andrew Ridgely formed the successful duo Wham!

Formerly of Cream, this legendary rock guitarist is nicknamed "Slowhand"

rounds.text: "The Wizard of Oz" & this 1950s film are the 2 musicals in the top 10 on the AFI's list
